message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.SI, cs.CC, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper deals with information theory and communication systems, specifically broadcast channels with receiver message side information and noncausal state available at the encoder. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also has applications in cellular communication systems, which suggests the sub-category cs.COMM (Communication and Networking). The use of polar codes is a key aspect of the paper, which could place it in the sub-category cs.SI (Signal Processing). The paper also deals with rate regions and achievable rates, which could place it in the sub-category cs.CC (Computational Complexity). Finally, the paper presents a polarization alignment scheme, which could suggest the sub-category cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
